dmca.title: [ABUSE] DMCA Notice (Ref: R4184)
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: The Planet Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Friday, January 07, 2005 1:44 PM
To: Notices
Cc: copyright@theplanet.com; copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: Re: [ABUSE] DMCA Notice (Ref: R4184)

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1



Your email is being sent to our copyright-related legal counsel at the
address copyright@theplanet.com for consideration.

- --
Thanks,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/aup/

N> 07 January 2005

N> Lance Crosby
N> Theplanet.com Internet Services
N> 1333 North Stemmons Freeway
N> Suite 110
N> Dallas
N> 75207
N> United States
N> Telephone: +1 854-7679
N> E-mail: abuse@theplanet.com
N> E-mail: copyright@theplanet.com

N> Ref: R4184
N> Re:
N> http://www.spec3.net/music/

N> Dear Lance Crosby,

N> I am contacting you on behalf of the International Federation of the
N> Phonographic Industry (IFPI) and its member record companies.  The IFPI
is
N> a trade association whose member companies are some 1,450 major and
N> independent record companies in the US and internationally who create,
N> manufacture and distribute sound recordings. Under penalty of perjury, we
N> submit that the IFPI is authorized to act on behalf of its member
N> companies in matters involving the infringement of their sound
recordings,
N> including enforcing their copyrights and common law rights on the
N> Internet.

N> We have learned that your service is hosting infringing files on its
N> network (see above-referenced directory).  These files contain sound
N> recordings by the artists known as Feeder, Jay-Z, lostprophets,
Hoobastank
N> and Seether.  These sound recordings are owned by some of our member
N> companies and have not been authorized for this kind of use.  We have a
N> good faith belief that the above-described activity is not authorized by
N> the copyright owner, its agent, or the law.  We assert that the
N> information in this notification is accurate, based upon the data
N> available to us.

N> We are asking for your immediate assistance in stopping this unauthorized
N> activity.  Specifically, we request that you remove the infringing files
N> from your system or that you disable access to the infringing files.  In
N> addition, please inform the site operator of the illegality of his or her
N> conduct.

N> You should understand that this letter constitutes notice to you that
this
N> site operator may be liable for the infringing activity occurring on your
N> service. In addition, under the Digital Millennium Copyright Act, if you
N> ignore this notice, you and/or your company may also be liable for any
N> resulting infringement. This letter does not constitute a waiver of any
N> right to recover damages incurred by virtue of any such unauthorized
N> activities, and such rights as well as claims for other relief are
N> expressly retained.

N> You may contact me at IFPI Secretariat, 54 Regent Street, London W1B 5RE,
N> United Kingdom or email Notices@ifpi.org, to discuss this notice.  We
N> await your response.

N> Sincerely,





N> Mr Paul Mitchell

N> Internet Anti-Piracy Administrator
N> IFPI Secretariat
N> 54 Regent Street

N> London W1B 5RE

N> United Kingdom

N> Tel: +44 (0)20 7878 7915

N> Fax: +44 (0)20 7878 6832

N> E-mail: Notices@ifpi.org
N> Website:  <http://www.ifpi.org/> www.ifpi.org
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
Version: GnuPG v1.2.5 (MingW32)

iD8DBQFB3uZivK/XpJs6oyURAnrBAJ9Tonw8XE8Gx8E8VmJJ+UQ1LcAYJwCdFyPH
KORcRecD6As8l7ajpKLtbls=
=cNWm
-----END PGP SIGNATURE-----
